result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank D Lashay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Eligible for the Substance Abuse and Challenge Incarceration Programs AFTER 20 months of confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 11CF359.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $3,500 per the restitution summary.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Bernard Coerper.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

All prescriptions from one pharmacy. 
Sign all releases so agent can monitor compliance. 
Comply with all requirements and recommendations of treatment program when released.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Frank D Lashay in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Frank D Lashay in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Melinda R Alfredson-Clausen appears by phone on behalf of the defendant on case 16CF70 - Atty Alfredson will have this plea/sentencing at a later date.
**Court informed the parties for case 16CF70 to contact Judicial Assistant for Br 3 and set a new plea/sentencing date.

10:41 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF60:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with victim notification; victim does not appear in the courtroom today.  
Atty Cousins provides a victim impact statement.
Atty Drengler has not received a copy of the statement; Court reads the victim impact statement to Atty Drengler.
Victim impact statement provided to Atty Drengler for review.
Court has reviewed the PSI that had been filed previously in 11CF359.
Atty Cousins is ready to proceed with sentencing without having reviewed the PSI.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and Counts 2 & 3 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Impose a 6 year  prison sentence
3 years of initial confinement - consecutive to 11CF359
3 years of extended supervision - consecutive to 11CF359
Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarcarcertion Program - eligible for these programs after 20 months of confinement
**Conditions of extended supervison:
Pay restitution in the amount of $3,500 per the restitution summary
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Bernard Coerper
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
All prescriptions from one pharmacy
Sign all releases so agent can monitor compliance.
Comply with all requirements and recommendations of treatment program when released.

20 days to appeal
Status conference on July 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Frank D Lashay in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Frank D Lashay in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CF60 & 16CF70 and 11CF359 (plea's already entered on this case)  Atty Melinda Clausen represents defendant on 16CF70.

8:32 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Court questions the parties on 11CF359; Atty Cousins indicates that he has received a revocation order.
Atty Drengler has the revocation order and warrant and Court has not received the packet.
Atty Cousins indicates that this is a significant case.
Atty Drengler makes statements on the record and indicates that they should be able to adjourn and re-schedule all for another date. 
Court will leave it up to counsel as to whether or not they need an adjournment; Atty Cousins makes statements on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Plea Hearing adjourned on:
11CF359 and to be set for Sentencing After Revocation
16CF60 and 16CF70 set for Status and may be resolved at this time also
Atty Clausen would request to appear by phone on 16CF70.  
Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.
letter from defendant requesting that his bond be mailed to him for his signature and then returned to COC Office - cc:  Ryan Drengler and Cass Cousins 06/14/16 sp
Plea Hearing set for 07/19/16 - no such number
Plea hearing on July 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Request from Waushara County DA's Office for certified bonds
signed by jail personnel but defendant refused to sign

**AMENDED**
This covers both 16CF60 and 16CF70:
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Bernard Coerper and Ashley Taylor
Pre-trial conference at 04-04-2016 09:30 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
State addresses bond and states the conditions on the record.

BY THE COURT: 
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Signature Bond issued and continued.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Frank D Lashay in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Frank D Lashay in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CF60 and 16CF70.

3:14 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Complaint received in 16CF60 and waives reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
